SUB_W07_WRLD_AMYA_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_WRLD_AMYA_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.text:
Wow, this world feels so rich in spirit power!
Might be able to gather a bunch of mana here,
but first, I've got a cat to find.

SUB_W07_WRLD_AMYA_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_WRLD_AMYA_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.text: Okay, Mr. Green Line. Where to?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
An altar, huh? I sense some faint spirit
power from here, but it's all smashed up.
Who would do something like this?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Oh my gosh, you're sooo cute!
Do you live here, faerie friend?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Don't worry, little sprite. I'm a witch,
so even if you can't talk, I'll understand
what it is you're trying to tell me.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text: We've a visitor at the Soul Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
A Flamewave League spy, perhaps?
I've not seen her like before.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
As if we would recruit so
ostentatious an agent!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
The Soul Temple has been the site of strange
phenomena since ancient times. Is that not
why we banded together to destroy it?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Are you suggesting this creature is
a Soul Voyager? Are we to be ruled
by the Soul Temple even now?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
If she is indeed a Soul Voyager,
we of the Flamewave League
will not engage with her.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
And nor will we of the
Forestgale Alliance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Wow, harsh! You're just going to
completely snub a visiting witch?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text: At least you've come back to me, faerie friend. Will you guide me around? You will? Aw, thanks for not ignoring me like those other jerkfaces!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Uh, so this is the guy who swore
he wouldn't talk to me.
Why guide me here?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Be welcome at the Flame Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Looks like someone finally got interested
in talking to the visiting witch!
Also, what's a 'Soul Voyager'?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
The Four Tribes of Cinq once had our lives
controlled by the Soul Temple. Eventually
we grew to despise its dominion over us,
and so banded together to destroy it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
In the days when we were still under its sway,
travelers would occasionally appear. We named
them Soul Voyagers, for whatever they sought
would greatly affect the lives of all in Cinq.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
We know well the power of a Soul Voyager,
and humbly request your assistance in
defeating the Forestgale Alliance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Well, look who's Mr. Warm and Friendly
all of a sudden. So what's going on
here now? You guys are at war?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Flamewave League and the Forestgale Alliance. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Flamewave League!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Take whatever time you need.
We await your favorable reply.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
What's your take on all this,
faerie friend?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
...You don't particularly care which one
I go with? Ha! I feel the exact same way!
I mean, I'll probably find my cat either way,
so I don't think there's a wrong choice here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.text:
Hi. I'm guessing you Flame Temple
guys also want my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Flamewave League do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.text:
What do you think?
Go with this one?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Thank you, Soul Voyager.
Now then, if I may be so bold as to
ask, we would appreciate your help.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text:
Be welcome at the Wave Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Waveflame League and the Forestgale Alliance. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Waveflame League!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.text:
Hi. I'm guessing you Wave Temple
guys also want my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Waveflame League do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
Be welcome at the Gale Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
We know well the power of a Soul Voyager,
and humbly request your assistance in
defeating the Flamewave League.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Galeforest Alliance and the Flamewave League. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Galeforest Alliance!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.text:
Hi. I'm guessing you Gale Temple
guys also want my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Galeforest Alliance do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text:
Be welcome at the Forest Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Forestgale Alliance and the Flamewave League. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Forestgale Alliance!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.text:
Hi. I'm guessing you Forest Temple
guys also want my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Forestgale Alliance do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We must boost our economic strength
if we hope to win this war. To this end,
we are creating factories one after another,
putting a strain on our energy supply.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
As our League has heat sources and water
in abundance, we use steam as our primary
means of generating power.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Hey, cool... So?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The output of our steam plant is dropping.
Should the Soul Voyager stop by, I am sure
both the problem and its solution will be
made apparent.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: And you really think that'll work?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_000_00.text:
These people live in a world crammed full
of spirit power, and they STILL go out of
their way to get energy through machines?
That's so much unnecessary work.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_000_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_000_01.text:
Hey, where are you
off to this time?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_000_02.speaker: Nitram

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_000_03.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_000_03.text:
Sweet! But, um, what am I
supposed to DO, exactly?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_010_00.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_010_00.text:
I expected no less from you, Voyager!
Those fiends are sent by the Forestgale
Alliance, and perpetually cause damage
in this place. But today, the plant remains unharmed!
Sadly for the beasts, they cannot say the same.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_141_CUT_010_01.text:
I do not expect the Forestgale Alliance
to launch another attack any time soon,
so thank you again for your efforts.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
With the issue at the steam plant resolved,
our factories can now operate at full capacity.
However, we've realized our transportation
infrastructure cannot handle the output.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We need more harbors and ships. Furthermore,
our current lack of shipyards will surely lead
to additional problems down the road.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You know, if you just learned to fly
through the air on broomsticks,
you wouldn't need ships at all.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I'd like to ask you to visit a shipyard
construction site, where I feel certain
your presence will cause something
quite beneficial to transpire.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
It'd be awesome if you could
be more vague about it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_00.text:
So this is where they're
building the shipyard?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_01.text: Aw! My faerie friend ran off again!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_02.text:
Welcome, Voyager! Your arrival will
surely hasten the construction of
this important site!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_03.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_03.text:
It will? I mean, yeah, I guess it would!
I totally get how having a cutie like me
around would get your workers all fired up.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_04.text:
Wow, everyone's working so hard! Still, I wonder
how long I'll need to stay here to keep them
motivated, because watching a shipyard being
built is up there with watching clothes dry.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_05.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_05.text: Huh? You want me to come this way?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_06.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_06.text:
Uh-oh! Looks like somebody
accidently left this crate here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_07.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_07.text:
Wait, is this a BOMB!? Oh, yikes!
Whatever this is doing here,
this is NOT where it belongs!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_08.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_08.text:
Are you all right, Voyager!?
I heard an explosion!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_09.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_09.text:
Oh wow, I didn't think it would ACTUALLY
explode! I'm just glad nobody got hurt.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_10.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_10.text:
This is clearly the work of the Forestgale
Alliance—one of their spies must have
infiltrated the site. I will begin a
thorough investigation at once!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_11.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_11.text:
How did you locate that bomb,
if you don't mind my asking?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_12.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_12.text:
Magic! I'm a witch, see?
It's kind of what I do.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_13.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_000_13.text:
Your being here was a
great blessing. Thank you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_010_00.text:
Thanks for your help, faerie friend.
You saved all those people!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_010_01.text:
If you keep getting in our way, Voyager,
I'm afraid I'll have to get rid of you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_010_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_142_CUT_010_02.text: Man, you go help out these guys, and then those guys hate you for it! Although to be fair, that's pretty much how it works in every world.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I'm given to understand that you foiled the
enemy's attempt to sabotage our new shipyard.
You Soul Voyagers truly are special beings!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Construction of the shipyard is now complete,
offering a solution to our long-term shipping
problems. However, we would like to bring our
war with the Forestgale Alliance to a swifter end.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You're gonna declare war
on the Forestgale Alliance?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The backbone of the Forestgale Alliance's
economy is their system of railways.
Something must be done about it.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Look, if you want a war, just go fight
'em already. I can't stand all this
sneaky-pants roundabout stuff.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
All we ask is that you visit a train
station of the Forestgale Alliance.
The rest will take care of itself.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_00.text:
So this is a Forestgale Alliance train station?
I'm sure it's handy, but I can't imagine the
spirits of this land care much for all these
giant metal boxes clanging around.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_01.text:
Ah, the Soul Voyager!
What are you doing here?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_02.text:
I came to see your train line. The people
of this world only seem to use spirit power
to craft new technologies—and as a witch,
that feels SUPER backward. It's like you're happy to exploit nature,
but nature itself means nothing to you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_03.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_03.text:
Voyagers have no right to criticize our ways.
Observe if you wish, but know we will be
closely monitoring every move you make.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_04.text:
Hey, monitor away! I don't give a...
Wait. You there, on the right.
Don't I know you from somewhere?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_06.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_06.text:
I trust you've seen enough?
Perhaps it's time you departed.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_07.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_07.text:
Thanks for escorting me out, guys.
It's been a real delight.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_08.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_08.text:
Where the Voyager travels, calamity follows.
I am relieved to see that this instance
proved to be the exception to the—

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_10.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_10.text:
And we were too distracted with the Voyager
to see it coming! Damn you, Voyager!
You have brought ruin upon us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_11.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_11.text: Seems like all the awesome things they build out of spirit power get destroyed by weapons that they build out of other spirit power. This is all just so dumb!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_12.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_143_CUT_000_12.text:
I can tell that you're pretty
upset about it too, faerie friend.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our verdant forests supply the Alliance
with an ample amount of lumber.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sadly, we have fallen far behind in
the task of processing said lumber;
we simply cannot afford to maintain
the necessary workforce.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: So you want to use machines instead.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Indeed we do, which is why the tribes of Forest
and Gale have begun working together to
construct a mill. Sadly, the project is beset
with issues I am hoping you might resolve.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The peoples of gale and forest have begun
working together to construct a lumber mill.
However, the project is beset with issues
that I am hoping you might resolve.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Well, I'll give it a shot.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_00.text:
So they're building a mill here, huh?
I mean, not that I see a whole lot
of building going on...

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_01.text:
Where you going now,
faerie friend?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_02.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_02.text:
I am pleased to see you come, Voyager. Alas,
those of the Gale Tribe who are supposed to
be helping us construct the mill refuse to work. Might I ask you to scold them in my stead?
While they ignore me, they'll not so easily
shrug off a rebuke from a Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_03.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_03.text:
Sure! I mean, once I hear
their side of the story.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_04.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_04.text:
The work is just too dangerous! These woods
are filled with all manner of horrid beasts,
and they're perpetually waiting for a chance
to make us their dinner! We tried telling the Forest Tribe that you can't
build a mill when you're always looking over
your shoulder, but they don't seem to care!
I simply don't understand their kind...

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_05.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_05.text:
Hey, nobody wants to end up as someone
else's dinner! Lemme take a look and see
what we're dealing with here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_07.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_07.text:
To the Forest Tribe, beasts of the wood are
treasured neighbors with whom we coexist. And while we do eat them at times, our hunting
season is primarily for population control.
We cannot simply slaughter them indiscriminately
to ease the nerves of some cowardly wind people!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_08.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_08.text:
Yeah, well, the creature I fought earlier wasn't
one of your beloved beast neighbors:
it was actually a fiend!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_09.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_09.text: Hmm. We have sensed a disturbing decline in the beasts' numbers of late, so perhaps this is the reason. Which means... Of course! Those villains from the Flamewave League must be releasing fiends into our woods! Might I ask you to cull the numbers of these interlopers, Voyager?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_10.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_000_10.text:
Yeah, probably not a bad idea—
for the beasts AND you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_010_00.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_010_00.text:
Now the Gale Tribe
can work without fear.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_231_CUT_010_01.text:
I can't believe the Flamewave League was behind
those monsters! They very nearly managed to
cause strife between us and the Forest Tribe,
and they will pay dearly for it!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Thanks to the new mill, we'll be able to
finish some large-scale construction
projects that were on hold.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our next project is installing wind turbines in the
Gale Tribe's residential district. If we complete
that, the Alliance's energy production will finally
be comparable to that of the League.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I don't see how energy from nature can
belong to anybody, but I'll let that go.
What exactly do you want my help with here?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Oh, I appreciate someone who doesn't beat
around the bush! The crux of it is this: we expect
the League to attempt to sabotage the project,
for there's no low their kind won't sink to.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our next project is installing wind turbines
in the Gale Tribe's residential district.
But we expect the League to attempt sabotage,
for there's no low their kind won't sink to.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You think they'll send fiends
after the workers again?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_00.text:
Whoa, they're HUGE! I guess these catch
the wind and use it to produce energy?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_01.text:
Yes, and the greater the project,
the harder it is to defend. We've already had a rash of suspicious fires
that destroyed precious materials recently
delivered from the mill. Without a doubt,
this is the work of the Flamewave League.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_05.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_05.text:
*yaaawn* I'm...so tired...
Chasing off arsonists night after night
is NOT what I had in mind when I agreed
to guard this stupid place!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_06.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_06.text:
Thanks to you, our materials are safe,
and construction is proceeding smoothly.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_07.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_07.text:
Well it sure would be nice if the
other side got the hint and gave up,
but I won't be holding my breath.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_09.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_09.text: Fiend! A giant fiend is coming!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_10.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_000_10.text:
Finally bringing out the big guns,
huh? Time to stand and fight!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_010_00.text: Okay, now they've GOT to throw in the towel.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_010_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_232_CUT_010_01.text:
What's that? You praising me, fella?
Well, ain't that just swell.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Various industries have been reaping the
benefit of the Alliance's new wind energy,
and our economic prospects seem bright.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sadly, while we strive to live in greater
harmony with nature than the Flamewave League,
this has put us at a disadvantage in the war.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Even with our recent gains,
our loss is inevitable.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Why would living in harmony with nature
put you at a disadvantage? You guys really
need to put more faith in the wider world
that you can't necessarily see.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Regardless, our only option now is
to attack the enemy's infrastructure.
If we can destroy the port, we will
deal a great blow to their economy!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Don't think I got through
to him there.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_00.text:
Much as I didn't want to do this,
I couldn't help but wonder.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_01.text:
Did you feel the same,
faerie friend?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_02.text:
You have come, Voyager—
just as our intelligence predicted.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_03.text:
We know you are planning to destroy the port,
and I will not allow it! Your meddling will cause
no harm to the League today!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_04.text:
They didn't listen to a thing I said!
They just wanted me to be their decoy
while they blew up the port.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_05.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_05.text:
Cease your mumbling! Now then, tell me who sent you and
why you have come. I need to hear
a confession from your own lips.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_06.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_233_CUT_000_06.text: Wake up, dummy. It's already over.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Our long war is finally over!
The Flamewave League stands victorious!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Our League has proven its dominance
thanks to the Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Should your travels bring you to this
world again, please do visit our temple.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Not exactly a heartfelt parting
for any of us there. Well, I guess I fulfilled my duty as
the 'Soul Voyager.' Can't say I feel
all that good about it, but at least
now I'm free to find my cat!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Do you have any idea where
the cat might be?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text: ...What's that? It's still too early to go looking for the kitty?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Our long war is finally over!
The Forestgale Alliance stands victorious!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Our Alliance has proven its dominance
thanks to the Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Should your travels bring you to this
world again, please do visit our temple.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
So the 'Soul Voyager' was just a tool to
help them win their stupid war—and now
that it's over, I get tossed aside? I can't decide if I should be furious
about this or not care at all.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
So hey, do you happen to know
where a girl might find a cat?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Seems like someone wants me to continue
my fateful visit a little longer, huh?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
I really hope we helped to end the war,
yet somehow I doubt it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
You have come at an opportune time,
Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Ugh. I knew it. Whenever I suspect
something is wrong, it usually is.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Wave Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
But the tribes of Flame and Wave made such a
great team when they were working together!
Why break that up now?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Wave Temple sees things differently,
and has decreed our people can never be one.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Take whatever time you need.
We await your favorable reply.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
It's everything we feared it
would be, faerie friend.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Everyone here seem to think this world's spirit 
power belongs to them alone, which means they're
just gonna keep fighting until someone wins!
Why can't they see that?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.text:
Okay, come on! You Flame Temple
guys are planning the same thing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Wave Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Flame Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
But the tribes of Flame and Wave made such a
great team when they were working together!
Why break that up now?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Flame Temple sees things differently,
and has decreed our people can never be one.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Okay, come on! You Wave Temple
guys are planning the same thing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Flame Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Forest Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
But you and the Forest Tribe were a team!
Why break up the alliance?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Forest Temple sees things differently,
and claims the forest has no need of wind.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.text:
Okay, come on! You Gale Temple
guys are planning the same thing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Forest Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Gale Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
But you and the Gale Tribe were a team!
Why break up the alliance?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Gale Temple sees things differently,
and declared the woods an obstacle to wind.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Okay, come on! You Forest Temple
guys are planning the same thing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Gale Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We were able to claim victory in our war
against the Forestgale Alliance due to our
superior energy production.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
So are you going to build
another steam power plant?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No. That would take far too long, causing
us to fall behind in the war against the
wave people. Instead, we seek to upgrade
our current plant.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yeah, that's sounds like a job for an
engineer or something. Way above this
girl's pay grade, at any rate.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I ask only that you visit the plant.
That should ensure all goes smoothly.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
That's really all the explanation
you're going to give me?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_00.text:
The energy from this plant is shared with
the Wave Tribe, right? So why can't you
both collaborate on it?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_01.text:
Because their incessant harassment
has completely stalled our plans
to upgrade the power plant!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_03.text:
They loose fiends near the cooling pools,
which both endangers our staff and reduces
the plant's efficiency.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_000_04.text: See, now that's the sort of thing I can help with. Lemme at 'em!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_010_00.text:
I could see how those fiends would give the
Flame Tribe trouble, but they really weren't
much to write home about. I don't think the
Wave Tribe was all that serious about this.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_101_CUT_010_01.text:
While you have my gratitude, Voyager,
you know little of the Wave Tribe.
They are indeed set on annihilating
our kind!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We wish to make use of various minerals
which can be obtained from volcanoes.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Oooh, a special volcanic mineral?
Like the kind that can be used
as a catalyst for magic?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No, they are nothing so special.
We simply intend to melt them down
with the energy from our plant.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Wait, you're melting them with machines?
These things come from a VOLCANO!
Just use that to melt 'em!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You seem rather ignorant about our technology,
Voyager. We intend to build proper forges,
and use them to produce more potent weaponry
that will ensure our victory.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We intend to build proper forges,
and use them to produce more potent
weaponry that will ensure our victory.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
If I were you, I'd be doing a lot more
inner contemplation and a lot less
weapon production.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_01.text:
What you are feeling is the heat from the
volcano mingling with our fiery enthusiasm
for these ironworks.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_02.text:
Ugggh, this heat is miiiserable.
I just wanna get out of here
before I sweat my skin off.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_03.text:
The fire fiends here don't like our presence.
And while we're not afraid of their attacks,
per se, we also haven't figured out an
effective strategy to combat them.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_000_04.text:
Okay, well, lemme see what I can figure
out before I melt into a puddle of goo.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_010_00.text:
All this heat and I STILL got the
job done! Man, I'm good.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_102_CUT_010_01.text:
Thank you! Now we can finish the
ironworks without further incident.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We have arrived at a decision, Voyager:
we are going to destroy the shipyard
that once stood as a proud symbol
of the Flamewave League's unity.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You know what? Fine. It's your world,
and you can do what you want with it. Go ahead! Waste all your power building things
and then destroying them. See if I care.
This world is in a state of disaster,
and that disaster is ALL OF YOU!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
But you must understand, the psychological
damage this will deal to the Wave Tribe is the
best way to ensure a rapid victory.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
So what part of 'see if I care' didn't
get through to you? Go hog wild, man!
Just don't ask me to help.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We will win this war with or without
your assistance, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_000_00.text:
I wonder if they'll really go through
with destroying the shipyard.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_000_01.text:
I understand how you must feel, Voyager,
seeing as you once risked your life in defense
of the shipyard. But there is no other choice
left to us.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_000_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_000_02.text:
I wasn't the one who defended the shipyard—
it was my faerie friend. Speaking of,
I wonder how they feel about that now.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_010_00.text:
This is all just so sad...
How did it come to this?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_010_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_103_CUT_010_01.text:
Okay, that's it. I'm done.
I'm gonna find my cat and bounce.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
We have destroyed all the enemy
temples thanks to your good work.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Look, I know I'm just a traveler here,
but did you always see the other people
of this world as your enemies?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
No, of course not. Regardless, now that only
the Flame Temple remains, we can finally
cover the entirety of Cinq with magma.
Then only we will remain!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You have served us well, Soul Voyager,
and I wish to grant you tribute.
What is it you desire?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our transportation infrastructure gives us an
advantage over the Flame Tribe, for we can move
more on our waterways than on any land route—
so long as we have the ships, that is.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
So you're going to
build a new shipyard?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No. That would take far too long, causing
us to fall behind in the war against the
Flame Tribe. Instead, we seek to upgrade
our current one.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yeah, that's sounds like a job for an
engineer or something. Way above this
girl's pay grade, at any rate.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I ask only that you visit the shipyard.
That should ensure all goes smoothly.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
That's really all the explanation
you're going to give me?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_00.text:
This is the shipyard you defended.
Figured I might as well pay it a visit.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_01.text:
I heard you were going to upgrade it,
but what did you even have in mind?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_02.text:
While our shipyard is capable of producing
large-scale vessels, its facilities are
lacking due to its hasty construction
in the midst of the war. And since building large vessels is an
inefficient process at the best of times,
we must see this situation rectified.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_03.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_03.text: So you're looking to improve your facilities to build large ships more efficiently? I knew this wasn't a job for me.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_04.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_000_04.text: Ha ha! We certainly do not expect your help with that, Voyager. We have specialists in that field arriving any min—

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_010_00.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_010_00.text:
You truly have a knack for being where
you are needed most, Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_010_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_401_CUT_010_01.text:
Are you sure I don't just
invite trouble wherever I go?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our waterways are now so crowded that
we fear the possibility of a collision.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
See, this is EXACTLY why I told you to
look into broomsticks! So what's the plan?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We intend to construct a lighthouse
and highlight safe shipping routes.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
A new construction project. Of course.
Well, when this lighthouse is done,
I might just come to see it.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Actually, I would prefer
that you go see it now.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would like you to visit the
lighthouse construction site.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Because something bad's gonna happen?
Yeah, I know the drill.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_00.text:
Uh, this is where you're building the
lighthouse? There's nothing here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_01.text:
And had you not agreed to come, there would
never be a lighthouse to see, for fiends are
preventing us from building it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_02.text:
And were those fiends also
sent by the Flame Temple?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_03.text:
No, in fact—these appear to be native
creatures who simply don't appreciate
what we're doing in their territory.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_000_04.text: Well if there's one thing I actually can help with, it's driving off fiends!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_010_00.text:
Ugh! How many of these things
do I have to fight?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_010_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_402_CUT_010_01.text:
The fiends should calm down once
construction is finished and we
vacate the area.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We have arrived at a decision, Voyager:
we are going to destroy the steam plant
that once stood as a proud symbol of
the Waveflame League's unity.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: But that'll hurt YOUR people too!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, but it is still the best way to ensure
a rapid victory against the Flame Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Seems like a pretty meaningless
victory to me.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: No one asked for your opinion.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_00.text: How are you going to stop 'em?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_01.text:
If the pressure of the steam exceeds
a certain level, the plant will explode.
Accidents do happen, after all.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_02.text:
So the Wave Temple knows in advance
that an accident is going to happen?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_03.text:
Everyone knows about the potential for
accidents. If this one causes excessive
damage, it will be on the Flame Tribe for
not taking proper precautions.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_403_CUT_000_04.text: That's no excuse for causing an accident!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text:
As the Wave Tribe cannot survive for long in
the open air, we have no intentions of stealing
the lands of others. All we desire is for all to
live in peace within their own territories.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text:
Then why wage war with
other people at all?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text: Because they looked to conquer us! No, the peace we sought could only be secured through the destruction of all other temples.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We must increase our energy capacity without
attracting attention from the Forest Tribe.
To this end, we seek to upgrade our output
of wind energy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
By pretending you're looking for
things that need to be fixed?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, exactly so! Ah, but it is a relief
to have your keen insight on our side,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I feel like the Forest Tribe
will definitely notice that.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Indeed, the Forest Tribe is certain to
come investigate our dealings. Sadly,
I am at a loss for how to deter them.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Might I ask you to visit the wind farm?
I have no desire to risk trouble between
our peoples at this point.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Okay, I'll go—but only to keep more
dumb fights from breaking out!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_00.text:
Looks like a lot of the Gale Tribe
has come to observe the windmills—
Er, or to surveil them, I suppose.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_01.text:
It will be impossible to replace the
components necessary to boost our output
with so many people watching, Voyager.
What is to be done?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_02.text:
Maybe you could drive some
fiends into the area?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_03.text:
An interesting thought... Yet while the
Forest Tribe would certainly pay us little
mind during a fiend attack, it would also
place our workers in grave danger.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_000_04.text:
You can leave that to me!
I'll make sure your work goes smoothly.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_010_00.text:
Whoa! That's a WILD
amount of fiends!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_301_CUT_010_01.text:
We may have gotten carried away a bit,
and for this, I apologize. But surely
they were no more than a minor
inconvenience for you, Voyager?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
As there has been no change to the Forest
Tribe's supply of energy, they currently
suspect nothing. We must use this chance
to strengthen our own position.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
So what are you going to do?
Make weapons or something?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We intend to take measures such as increasing
food production in order to become fully self-
sufficient. In this way, we can continue the
war even after the forest people cut off trade.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
That...actually sounds like a
positive thing for your people.
I'm surprisingly on board.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Then I'd appreciate if you could visit
our farm, as its output is not increasing
in quite the way we had expected.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I don't know the first thing about farming,
but I'm sure it'll turn into one of those
'Soul Voyager' things once I show up.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_00.text:
So this isn't the fields kind of farm,
it's the barn kind of farm! And from the
size of this place, it should be able to
produce tons of food for the Gale Tribe.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_01.text:
With our wind power, even a small amount of
people can raise a large amount of livestock.
These will be used not only for consumption,
but for trade with other regions as well.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_02.text:
Sounds pretty great to me.
So what's the problem?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_03.text:
Barns are of little use with no livestock to
fill them—but before we can gather our herds
from the pastures, we must deal with the
various fiends in the area.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_04.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_000_04.text:
And you just realized this now?
...Oh, fine. I'll do what I can to
help you with the fiends.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_010_00.text: There. Done. The rest is up to you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_010_01.text:
Thank you, Voyager! Without your help,
we would be up for a severe tongue-lashing
from our leaders at the temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_010_02.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_302_CUT_010_02.text:
Yikes, man. What sort of jerks
are you working for here?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Forest Tribe are completely oblivious,
and one small push may be all it takes to
win their surrender. As such, I intend to
attack their lumber mill.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Is defeating their neighbors all the
people of this world ever think about?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Such an attack is the best way to
minimize damage on both sides,
and therefore the optimal strategy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Or you could consider the optimal-er strategy of not fighting at all.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No one is asking you to participate
in the attack, Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_303_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_303_CUT_000_00.text:
It wasn't that long ago that the tribes of forest
and gale came together to build this mill.
I guess bringing two different peoples together
isn't always a good thing...

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_303_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_303_CUT_000_01.text:
We worked ourselves near to death in this forest,
yet the Forest Tribe never made any effort to
understand our ways. For us, this place holds
naught but painful memories.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Now we can finally raze this terrible forest!
We will turn it from a terrifying den of beasts
into a peaceful grassland savanna—for one cannot
live on lava and water, nor grow crops there.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text: That's your way of life—you think the wind will just keep blowing as usual if all the woods disappear? Nature is connected in ways you people don't seem to understand!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
There will still be trees, Voyager—there is
simply no need for such dense forestland.
All that matters is the wind blowing through
the new grassy plains.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
How are we to defend ourselves from an assault by
the Gale Tribe? Alas, while we of the Forest Tribe
cannot match their strength, we've no choice but
to throw away our lives in the effort.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Oh, I don't know—maybe try talking to the Gale Tribe instead of attacking them all the time?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, we will definitely try that...
and afterward, we will optimize the
lumber mill! That is our only hope.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Well if there's anything I can
do to help, just lemme know.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would appreciate you going to the mill,
for I know your presence will bring
great cheer to all the workers.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would appreciate you going to the mill,
for I know your presence will bring
great cheer to all the workers.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_00.text:
Whoa, there's a huge crowd of Gale
Tribe people gathered at the mill.
What are they all doing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_01.text:
We laid off laborers who will no longer be
needed due to the mill upgrades, and now
they're interfering with the process! We even offered to find them new jobs,
but they refuse to listen.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_02.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_02.text:
We may have to take stronger
measures to remove them.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_03.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_03.text:
Just because you're in charge and they're not
doesn't mean you can ignore their opinions!
Also, I feel like these 'stronger measures'
of yours will only make things worse.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_04.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_000_04.text:
Look out! Some of the fiends the
Flamewave League sent are still alive!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_010_00.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_010_00.text:
With the former workers scattered,
we can now upgrade the mill.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_010_01.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_201_CUT_010_01.text:
Were those really fiends left over from
the Flamewave League? 'Cause I mean,
they wouldn't... Right?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our talks with the Gale Tribe did nothing
but heighten suspicions. We should never
have engaged with them at all.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Oof. Sorry to hear that. But I still
believe that talking to each other
is the only way to—

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
In response, we've formed a cavalry composed
of workers who were made redundant by the mill
upgrade. That should allow us to match the
speed of the gale peoples' forces.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And if you've got a cavalry,
I'm guessing you'll need stables?

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You guess correctly. As such, we would ask
you to visit the construction site, as we
anticipate interference from the Gale Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We would ask you to visit the construction
site of the stables, as we anticipate
interference from the Gale Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
If you both share this paranoid attitude,
no amount of discussion is going to
accomplish anything.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_202_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_202_CUT_000_00.text:
Do you really think the Gale Tribe will
try to interfere? I mean, I suppose it's
a possibility with the peace talks breaking
down and all, but still.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_202_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_202_CUT_000_01.text:
The wind blows in a strange direction today... 
I wonder if the Gale Tribe is using it
to send some fell beast after us.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_202_CUT_010_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_202_CUT_010_00.text:
Are you sure the Gale Tribe sent the fiends?
Because the timing of their appearance
could just be some huge coincidence.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Gale Tribe derives its strength
from the energy of their wind farm.
Without it, they are powerless.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Don't tell me you're planning
to destroy it!

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Gale Tribe uses their mastery of the breezes
to send countless fiends after us. We have no
option but to destroy the farm—although I do not
know if we actually possess the power to do so.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Without wind power, you'll have to return
to your preindustrial way of life—although
that might not be such a bad thing.

SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_AMYA_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I concur wholeheartedly. So long as we
have our forest, we will always be able
to fend for ourselves.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_203_CUT_000_00.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_203_CUT_000_00.text:
I can't believe they're going to
destroy the wind farm after they
spent so long building the thing.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_203_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_MISSION_203_CUT_000_01.text:
We will set the wind farm to burn.
If we are slain in the effort,
I leave the fate of the Forest Tribe
in your hands, Voyager. Farewell.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
The strength of the Gale Temple has been
reduced to nothing, and we can now live
lives free of worry. All praise to the forests, for they will
now spread unchecked across all of Cinq,
realizing our dream of a green world!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text: I mean, sure, that's a beautiful thought. But even if this world was covered with forests, the forces of fire, water, and wind would all reemerge from them at some point. I mean, you're sustained by more than forests. You know that, right?

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
While you may be correct, our dominance
will remain unchallenged so long as
everything is born from the forest.

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Can't believe I'm going home without finding
my cat. I have no idea what those stupid
green lines thought they were doing!

SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Ameya_Aisling
SUB_W07_EVAR_AMYA_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Aw, the cat was you all along!?
Thanks for guiding me, kitty!
